Methodology

The analysis builds on the PACTA (Paris Agreement Capital Transition Assessment) methodology developed by the 2° Investing Initiative (2DII) and a database of physical assets as well as forward looking production plans in eight key climate relevant sectors administered by Asset Resolution.

PACTA assesses the alignment of the technology-specific production plans of companies with decarbonization scenarios. The input data are asset-level data and for a time horizon of five years the output is an alignment measure capturing the discrepancy between company production plans and production plans set out in decarbonization scenarios. We do this analysis for the following sectors: light-and heavy-duty vehicles, power, oil and gas production. TODO: smth about the relevance of these sectors.

The data used for the analysis is as below:

Type of data Description Source
Financial data Used to assign securities to sectors and link them to parent and subsidiary companies. Bloomberg
Asset-Level data 2DII sources data from independent industry data providers who collect data on individual assets in climate-relevant industries using a variety of research capabilities, including web scraping, desk research and direct engagement with industry. These asset-level datasets cover more than 230,000 individual assets (power plants, oil fields etc) and account for more than 75% of global carbon emissions. Asset Resolution (based on sector-specific data providers)
Decarbonization scenarios Production plans are compared to climate scenarios published by the International Energy Agency and Joint Research Centre of the European Commission. International Energy Agency
ECB eligible assets List of all assets in the ECB’s collateral. ECB - Website

More about the methodology can be found here (TODO: add link. And do we need a methodology-page?)


Oil & Gas

Here we (aka Fiona) add some fancy text, to show how intelligent we (aka Fiona) are and how much we know about this sector. Just like “Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.”

You are not aligned!!!



Oil extraction of companies is set to increase in the next five years, not in line with even the most unambitious climate scenario. TODO: add interpretation to different lines. One gets similar results for the ‘potentially eligible’ list, but markedly different ones global bond market. Gas extraction is aligned with a Sustainable Development Scenario. This has been observed in previous assessments as well, but should be seen in light of existing cristicism on XYZ TODO: add that ausbau problematisch.

Below the reader can find the geographical locations of oil and gas extraction by companies in the collateral assets scheme. Oil and gas production is located primarily outside of the EU, the US having the largest share of production for both fossil fuels. Notable other countries for Oil production include (ranked by oil production at sites in this country): Iraq, Angola, Norway, UAE, Brazil and Nigeria. For Gas production (ranked by gas production at sites in this country): Egypt, Norway, Australia, Trinidad & Tobago, Qatar, Nigeria. As highlighted by different authors including here the location of a lot of oil and gas assets in sovereign countries highly dependent on those, might mean that a substantial part of these assets could become stranded. This means that it is not only important to consider the transition risk of the companies in the collateral framework that can directly contribute to price instability, but also the transition risk faced by highly fossil fuel dependent economies which can cause knock-on effects for further causes of risk. TODO: add why this might be a problem for the goal of the collateral framework.

Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.”

You are not aligned!!!



In none of the technologies the companies in the collateral assets scheme are aligned, often not even with a current policy-scenario. This is especially persistent in oil power capacity. TODO: add some more interpretation´

Below the reader can find the geographical locations of oil and gas extraction by companies in the collateral assets scheme. Power markets are nationally distinct, therefore decarbonization pathways are also very different between different countries TODO: add haircut-analysis



  • Coal capacity
  • Renewables capacity
  • Hydro Power capacity


One can also look at the technology mix of the ECB collateral framework in comparison with the global bond market and the EU economy.

As one can see there a bigger disparities between the ECB eligible assets and the EU Economy, as well as the global bond market. This questions the proclaimed “Market neutral investment” by the ECB.

Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.”

You are not aligned!!!



THE ECB’s collateral assets scheme is not aligned in this sector either. Especially in the production of hybrid vehicles it is lagging behind – even behind a current policy scenario, exposing companies in this sector to additional risks. The technology mix is nevertheless pretty similar across the three comparison groups. TODO: add some more interpretation´

One can also look at the technology mix of the ECB collateral framework in comparison with the global bond market and the EU economy.

The technology mix seems generally to agree, but the ECB elligible assets have a slightly higher share in ICE and less investments in electric vehicles, than the EU economy.
